intro: Ancylotropis insignis, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Ancylotropis insignis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
